51.title: The Next 15 Missed Opportunities of AT4W
51.plot:

 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Marville #6-7
1.plot: Linkara kicks off 2014 by finally reviewing the last issue of Marville.

2.title: Comic Book Quickies #2
2.plot: In another edition of Comic Book Quickies, Linkara reviews a Hostess fruit pie ad featuring the Fantastic Four, a Johnny Turbo comic with homo-erotic undertones, another Hostess commercial with Captain Marvel, and a cheesy '50s PSA on polio prevention.

3.title: All-Star Batman and Robin #7
3.plot: Linkara revisits Miller Time for ASBAR #7, featuring Crazy Steve beating, pummeling and immolating criminals, and then shagging Black Canary. Also included are the goddamn Batmobile, as well as Steve trying to make an avenger out of Dick Grayson Age 12.

4.title: Preparedness 101: A Zombie Pandemic
4.plot: Linkara gives a brief lecture on what to do in case we're ever overrun with zombies, and then looks at a CDC sanctioned comic that also prepares the world for when and if the Zombie Apocalypse comes to pass.

5.title: Gameboy #3
5.plot: Time for more Game Boy. Linkara delves into issue number three where, once again, Tatanga's forces recruit Herman to take them where they need to go to commence their plans for world domination, and only one tiny plumber can stop them.

6.title: US-1 #3
6.plot: Time to revisit good ol' Ulysses Archer, that honest, hard-working, red-blooded American truck driver who fights crime in his spare time, as Linkara returns to US-1 with issue #3.

7.title: Youngblood #6
7.plot: Time for more Youngblood, as Linkara honors the anniversary of his very first text review by looking at issue six.

8.title: Star Trek: Generations
8.plot: The Star Trek comic series continues with the adaptation of the seventh film: Star Trek: Generations. Linkara puts on his red suit and reviews the iconic entry in the Star Trek series where Captains Kirk and Picard finally meet - for a few minutes.

9.title: The A-Team #1
9.plot: It's more Mr. T, foo. Linkara reviews an A-Team comic chock full of high-flying action-packed hilarity as B.A.'s best buddy is revealed to be a diamond smuggler.

10.title: The Wild #1
10.plot: Linkara laments that there are no more issues of Brute Force, and tries to recapture the magic through a different series, The Wild. Alas, it does not and it's laden with typos and comma splices, forcing Linkara to play teacher and grade it.

11.title: Kamandi at Earth's End #5
11.plot: More Kamandi. This time they encounter Bearded Idiot and engage in a giant battle with machines that results in the loss of one of the heroes.

12.title: Nova Girls: Kissing Canvas
12.plot: Linkara reviews a horribly written, sexist photo-comic about a troupe of bumbling militant women on a space station in the future.

13.title: Avengers #200
13.plot: What do the Avengers have planned for their 200th issue? As Linkara discovers, it is a bizarre, sexist story featuring Captain Marvel giving birth to her son who turns out to be a reincarnated version of her lover/rapist.

14.title: SCI-Spy #5
14.plot: Linkara returns to SCI-Spy with issue 5, featuring a very bizarre twist that involves a literal out-of-body experience.

15.title: Red Hood and the Outlaws #1
15.plot: The New 52 rears its ugly head again as Linkara digs into Red Hood and the Outlaws #1, featuring anti-hero mercenaries and plenty of T&A.

16.title: Athena #2
16.plot: Once again, it's time to revisit Athena. No butts about it. Well, actually, plenty of butts about it, but at least Linkara manages to conclude that this issue was better than the first.

17.title: Bill and Ted's Excellent Comic Book #1
17.plot: The totally tubular comic dude Linkara reviews Bill & Ted's Most Excellent Comic Book. It's radical. It's got awesome historical dudes, a totally kooky Death and a bitchin' story of love and revenge.

18.title: Zolastraya and the Bard #1
18.plot: While at a convention, Linkara feels the urge to review an adventure comic, which is constantly interrupted by Team Four Star trying to get him to go on a real adventure.

19.title: Superman: For the Animals #1
19.plot: Welcome back to PSA Hell. Today, it's a Superman comic where the Man of Steel receives dozens of letters featuring all sorts of cries for help, including that of a young boy who has been baring witness to animal cruelty. Later, Dr. Linksano shows Linkara a new array of gadgets.

20.title: Chuck Norris: Karate Kommandos #2
20.plot: It's been 4 years since Linkara last visited Chuck Norris: Karate Kommandos, and after reading issue #2, he wishes he had put it off even longer.

21.title: Mighty Morphin' Power Rangers: The Movie #1
21.plot: Linkara reviews the Power Rangers movie comic, while saying he has no official opinion on the brand new Power Rangers movie which has only been announced at this point. As for the comic adaptation of the first movie, Linkara says it kinda sucks.

22.title: Speed Steer #5
22.plot: Today, Linkara reviews a comic about a superhero cow that encourages people to eat chicken instead. Despite getting a bum steer, he finds he has very little beef with it. Meanwhile, Dr. Linksano suddenly vanishes.

23.title: Batman: Jazz #2
23.plot: Back for more jazz with the Bat. Linkara reviews issue 2 of Batman: Jazz where the Caped Crusader continues to investigate the attempted murder of a famous blues musician, and points out how these books have very little to do with Batman himself.

24.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey #2
24.plot: It's more of the same in 2001: A Space Odyssey #2 as we follow the exploits of Vira the she-demon who comes across the monolith, followed by a few jumps in time and space, and ending on pretty much the same note as before.

25.title: Comic Book Quickies #3
25.plot: More commercial comics ahoy. These include Hulk meeting a crazy plant lady and her mutated plants, Spider-Man rescuing Cap'N Crunch, Aunt May teaming up with Franklin Richards, and a toy ad with Superman. Linkara even tries a Hostess fruit pie himself to see what all the fuss is about.

26.title: Frank Miller's Holy Terror
26.plot: For his 300th episode, Linkara reviews what is perceived to be Frank Miller's worst work yet: Holy Terror.

27.title: Godzilla: Kingdom of Monsters #1
27.plot: Linkara reviews a zany Godzilla comic where the King of the Monsters devastates a small community, and their solution is to fire nukes at him. The result gives a whole new meaning to the term "dragon breath."

28.title: Batman: Shadow of the Bat #56
28.plot: In another edition of PSA Hell, Linkara reviews a cryptic comic about Batman going up against a drug war, genetically enhanced marijuana and Poison Ivy.

29.title: Sinnamon #1
29.plot: Linkara revisits that scantily clad super-heroine Sinnamon in her very first issue that explains little to nothing about the character, her allies or her enemies.

30.title: US-1 #4
30.plot: In issue #4, Ulysses goes up against the kooky Baron Von Blimp in a race that pits his truck against the baron's air ship. Add a whole gaggle of chickens to the mix and Linkara has clucking hysterics.

31.title: The Adventures of Jell-O Man and Wobbly #1
31.plot: Because, you know, comics about food mascots are always big hits. Linkara sits himself down to read a comic about Jell-O Man and his dog Wobbly on inane quests to retrieve stolen Jell-O desserts.

32.title: All-Star Batman and Robin #8
32.plot: In this continuing saga of insanity, Dick Grayson age 12 fashions himself a superhero costume, Crazy Steve goes up against the Green Lantern, and a self-proclaimed unfunny Joker just - does things.

33.title: Tandy Computer Whiz Kids: The Computer That Said No to Drugs
33.plot: Linkara experiences deja vu as he revisits those freaky, computer-obsessed kids for yet another story about selling computers and the dangers of drug use, along with a subplot about drug smugglers.

34.title: Marvel Super Special #17: Xanadu
34.plot: Linkara reviews a comic adaptation of the 1980 musical film Xanadu. It's magic, and music, and art. None of which are ever fully explained.

35.title: SCI-Spy #6
35.plot: At long last, Linkara comes to the final issue of SCI-Spy. And they sure go out true to form.

36.title: Kamandi at Earth's End #6
36.plot: Kamandi at Earth's End has come to an end, as Linkara reviews the sixth and final issue. It makes about as much sense as the previous five issues.

37.title: Sonic Super Special #7
37.plot: Against his better judgment, Linkara decides to review another Sonic the Hedgehog comic, featuring a barrage of weirdly-drawn Image characters, and even Mulder and Scully show up for no reason.

38.title: Star Trek: First Contact
38.plot: Linkara reviews the comic adaptation of his favorite Next Generation Star Trek film: First Contact. He complains about its lack of loyalty to the source material.

39.title: Cosmic Slam #1
39.plot: Linkara discovers that the only people capable of saving Earth from an invasion of meteorites that mutate trees are professional baseball players.

40.title: The Thing from Another World: Eternal Vows #1-2
40.plot: To welcome the Halloween season back, Linkara reviews another entry into The Thing From Another World series. These are so bad they make The Thing (2011) look like The Thing (1982).

41.title: The Thing from Another World: Eternal Vows #3-4
41.plot: More Eternal Vows with two asinine comics that play by their own rules. After that, Linkara and friends prepare to face off with The King of Worms.

42.title: The Thing from Another World: Questionable Research
42.plot: Linkara finds himself trapped in another dimension, his friends having been replaced by androids loyal to the King of Worms. He passes the time by reviewing the last of the Thing From Another World comics.

43.title: Spider-Man: The Trial of Peter Parker
43.plot: In honor of his sixth anniversary, Linkara carries on the tradition of reviewing a Spider-Man Clone Saga comic, which really proves to be a mistrial. Meanwhile, Pollo and his band of robot bodies rescue Linkara as they put an end to the King of Worms.

44.title: Whiz Comics #2
44.plot: The origins of Captain Marvel are explored in the first week of Secret Origins Month 2014.

45.title: Tales to Astonish #44
45.plot: Secret Origins Month continues with the back-story of Ant-Man that completely contradicts his previous back-story, as well as the details of his new partner-in-peril, The Wasp. This comic really bugs Linkara.

46.title: Detective Comics #38
46.plot: Linkara explores the origins of Batman's sidekick Robin, the Boy Wonder. Back when the Caped Crusader's moral code wasn't quite defined.

47.title: The Avengers #1
47.plot: Secret Origins Month 2014 closes out with the issue that assembles together the ultimate superhero team. But before they can team up to battle the evil forces of Loki, they have to set aside their own personal differences.

48.title: The Hobbit #1
48.plot: Linkara kicks off the Christmas season by reading the 3-part Hobbit comic series, due to the third and final Hobbit film set to hit theaters in December. He finds the reading experience to be a pleasant one, but is dismayed by the amount of characters and their lack of characterization.

49.title: The Hobbit #2
49.plot: Linkara reviews Book II of the Hobbit fable, featuring Bilbo and Gollum in a battle of wits, while the armies of elves and dwarfs get under each others' skin, and there are some giant eagles and spiders thrown into the mix. Linkara is still miffed about the dwarfs' lack of characterization.

50.title: The Hobbit #3
50.plot: Linkara concludes the Hobbit trilogy where our heroes make an unexpected journey to a cave of treasure, witness the desolation of Smaug, and prepare for the battle of the Five Armies.

51.title: Santa the Barbarian #1
51.plot: On the week of Christmas, Linkara reviews a Rob Liefeld Christmas Special comic about a big, muscle-bound, ax-wielding, homicidal Santa Claus who travels the world to punish them what's been naughty.

52.title: Top 15 Worst Comics I've Reviewed
52.plot: With 2014 coming to a close, Linkara reflects back on all the trials and tribulations of his year, as well as digging deep into his comic collection to showcase 15 of the worst comics he has ever reviewed...so far.

1.title: All-Star Batman and Robin #9
1.plot: More All-Star Crazy Steve. In today's issue, Linkara suffers through a battle of (dim)wits between Steve and Green Lantern.

2.title: Godzilla: Kingdom of Monsters #2
2.plot: Linkara reads another Godzilla comic. Godzilla attacks Japan, while Rodan terrorizes Russia and Anguirus spreads mayhem in Mexico, and the world leaders are too powerless, and clueless, to stop them.

3.title: Trouble #1
3.plot: Is the subject of teen romance in comics dead? According to Trouble #1, yes. Yes, it is. Linkara reviews a romance comic penned by Kick-Ass writer Mark Millar, that details four teens going off for the summer to "lose it."

4.title: Comic Book Quickies #4
4.plot: Linkara reads more Comic Book Quickies. Today's mish-mash of madness includes Spider-Man slinging Hostess fruit pies, Johnny West pushing Acme boots, a young woman looking for love in all the wrong places, and Spidey once again leading the fight in a battle between good and cream-filled.

5.title: Energy and Safety with the Justice League
5.plot: When they're not out saving the world from super-villains, the Justice League go around town lecturing people on proper energy consumption, conservation and preserving our environment by any means necessary. In other words, it's another edition of PSA Hell. This one brought to us by our friends at Con Edison. Linkara finds the whole thing energy draining.

6.title: Youngblood #7
6.plot: That's right, folks. It's time for Linkara to review Youngblood #7, and there's no turning back now. This exciting, edge-of-your-seat romp features Shaft having gluttonous dreams, Badrock hitting the ski slopes and Troll showing off his 24-pack in the shower.

7.title: ROMtrospective: ROM Spaceknight #1-40
7.plot: Linkara begins his retrospective of ROM, the toy-turned-comic-superhero epic about a robot warrior who wanders the universe for 200 years before arriving on earth, with the first 40 issues of the short-lived metallic hero's saga. Meanwhile, Pollo gets a new voice.

8.title: ROMtrospective: ROM Spaceknight #41-75
8.plot: Linkara continues his little ROM-trospective, by showcasing the final 34 issues, featuring our robotic hero defending earth from the Dire Wraiths, a species of shape-shifting aliens who wreak untold havoc on the masses. But he won't be going at it alone. A distress call is put out, and the gang is all here.

9.title: The Star Wars #1
9.plot: A short time ago on a green couch not-so-far away, Linkara reviewed the comic adaptation of George Lucas' very early draft of Star Wars. General Skywalker is pitted against Darth Vader without a mask and the Emperor without a cloak. Weird and nonsensical, but he doesn't have a bad feeling about this.

10.title: Batman: Jazz #3
10.plot: Linkara reviews the final issue of Batman: Jazz, a nonsensical comic trilogy in its own right. In this one, the Caped Crusader continues his quest to investigate the attempt on jazz musician Blue Byrd's life. The genre of jazz itself depends on it.

11.title: Mr. T and the T-Force #3
11.plot: Hilarious hijinks and important life lessons are in full swing as Mister T goes up against a car theft ring.

12.title: Big Bang Presents #3: Protoplasman!
12.plot: Linkara reviews a request comic from a series that pays homage to the Gold and Silver Age of comics. This one is about Dr. Fang, a nefarious Nazi vampire banished to America, where he wreaks untold havoc. Only the unadulterated, champion of justice, known only as Protoplasman, a man comprised entirely of protoplasm, can stop him.

13.title: Crimson #1
13.plot: Another request comic today, featuring a lost race of early humans whose story was apparently left out of the Bible. For you see, they are a race of vampires. They existed in secret for centuries, until one day, they came across a selfish teenager and made him one of them.

14.title: Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines
14.plot: In a slight change of pace, but going with his current vampire theme, Linkara reviews a video game. A vampire RPG that puts the player right in the middle of the terrifying action of a battle between vampires and anarchists.

15.title: Titans: Scissors, Paper, Stone
15.plot: Linkara looks at an Elseworlds Teen Titans comic. He finds that because it is an Elseworlds comic, it has nothing to do with the established Teen Titans. It's an Anime comic that takes place in a strange world full of self-awareness, clichés, cyborgs, explosions, giant asteroids and scientific mumbo-jumbo jargon straight from Dr. Insano's wet dreams.

16.title: Batman: Shadow of the Bat #57
16.plot: After chasing away a slew of convention cameos, Linkara kicks off another PSA Hell. This one featuring that photosynthesized femme fatale: Poison Ivy. She teams up with Dr. Jason Woodrue, who broke her out of Arkham, and has a diabolical plan of conquering the world by way of marijuana.

17.title: Comic Book Quickies #5
17.plot: This batch of comic shorts consists of an Aquaman story in which he does absolutely nothing and there's a buried treasure of Hostess Twinkies. Then, Indiana Jones and his junior token sidekick encounter a strange temple that is said to be doomed; and finally, Captain America rescues Nick Fury from the Trapster by bribing him with Hostess Fruit Pies.

18.title: Avengers Assemble Featuring Captain Citrus #1
18.plot: Orange sales have decreased dramatically in Florida. In fact, it's such a big deal that Marvel decided to release a PSA comic about it in which the Avengers join forces with Captain Citrus, an all powerful being that can shoot sunbeams from his eyes but has little to do with citrus, to battle an invasion of androids.

19.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation/Doctor Who: Assimilation Squared #1-8
19.plot: Worlds collide as two of Linkara's favorite franchises, Star Trek and Doctor Who, come together in an eight comic mini-series. The battle for both time and space is on as Linkara reviews all crazy eight issues while dispersing his vast knowledge of the Starfleet crews, the 12 Doctors and especially, the Cyber Men.

20.title: My Cage
20.plot: Because the fans won't stop giving him good comics to review, Linkara must abide by today's request: a comic strip, as opposed to a book, entitled My Cage. The story is essentially Dilbert if he were a platypus...and had a personality.

21.title: The Punisher #60
21.plot: Linkara reviews a bizarre Punisher story in which Frank Castle gets the reverse Michael Jackson treatment and looks like a black man, then he teams up with Luke Cage to try and stop an impending gang war.

22.title: The Punisher #61 and #62
22.plot: Linkara continues the story of Luke Cage and a black Punisher hit the streets to stop a violent gang war. Then it becomes an action-adventure, superhero version of The Odd Couple in which Cage is the moralistic hero who won't kill, and Frank Castle is the vigilante with nothing to lose, and this causes endless bickering between them.

23.title: Steam Wars
23.plot: May the farce be with you as Linkara looks at a Steam Wars comic. What's Steam Wars, you might ask? It's like Star Wars, only with steam.

24.title: Ultimate Power #1-2
24.plot: For his 350th episode, Linkara finally gets around to talking about a comic artist that's been a thorn in his side for some time: Greg Land, tracer extraordinaire. Linkara reviews his Ultimate Power series that features Marvel's top heroes and universes almost literally collide.

25.title: Homestuck, Act 1
25.plot: Ask and ye shall receive. Linkara's dedicated and semi-loyal Patreon sponsors have requested he review a web comic. Not very partial to that particular medium, Linkara fulfills their request anyway and looks at Homestuck, Act 1. It's unlike any comic he's ever reviewed before, because this one is interactive.

26.title: Atomic Robo, vol. 3
26.plot: Linkara's Patreon sponsors provide him with another good comic, but a very strange one. It follows the adventures of Atomic Robo, a man with the body of a robot, created by the great Nikola Tesla, as he, along with Charles Fort and Carl Sagan attempt to stop H.P. Lovecraft's mutated monster from devouring the entire world.

27.title: Just Imagine Stan Lee Creating Superman
27.plot: This month, Linkara looks at a mini-series that shows what it would be like if Mr. Marvel himself, Stan Lee, created the DC Universe. Today, it's his version of Superman: a man named Salden who battles terrorists in a far away galaxy, but when he winds up on earth to find his lover's killer, he finds he's developed some form of enhanced super powers.

28.title: Just Imagine Stan Lee Creating Batman
28.plot: So, how would Stan Lee alter Batman's back-story? Well, as Linkara finds out in this week's comic, the Dark Knight started out as Wayne Williams, an upstanding citizen whose father was killed by gangsters, and he finds himself framed for armed robbery and sent to prison. While in stir, Wayne befriends bats, bulks up, stops a riot and is pardoned, and after hearing his mother died of natural causes, Wayne starts his life anew by creating a bat costume, taking up wrestling and becoming a rich sellout.

29.title: Just Imagine Stan Lee Creating Wonder Woman
29.plot: So, Stan the Man, what would Wonder Woman be like if you created her? Well, when Linkara reviews his version, he discovers Wonder Woman started out in South America as a young girl named Maria Mendoza. She witnesses her father being murdered by a greedy land developer, and then stumbles upon ruins of an ancient civilization. Hidden within the ruins is a golden staff that gives her magical powers.

30.title: Just Imagine Stan Lee Creating the Flash
30.plot: After seeing how Stan the Man would have created Superman, Batman and Wonder Woman, Linkara closes out the month by seeing how he would've done The Flash differently: as a young girl named Mary Maxwell whose father is a naive, semi-mad scientist wanted by an evil organization for his formula on time travel. How does Mary get her powers? Some mysterious fog out at sea and a huge dose of humming bird DNA.

31.title: Zyuranger Episodes 17-22
31.plot: Never to be one to shy away from breaking format, especially when his semi-loyal Patreon sponsors demand it, Linkara reviews a few episodes from the Japanese TV series that spawned his biggest obsession - er, his favorite show and heroes of all time, The Power Rangers.

32.title: Tandy Computer Whiz Kids: The Computer Trap
32.plot: Time for more adventures of the Tandy Computer Whiz Demon Spawn. Today's tale is a step backwards, and not just in human evolution, for this is the second comic published about Alec and Shanna, in which they band together to stop terrorism...and sell Tandy Computers, making Linkara wanna crash.

33.title: Trouble #2
33.plot: More Trouble for Linkara. Those four delightful teens from the last issue have finally had sex, or rather 2 of them have, the other 2 are experiencing sexual frustrations as the girl is superstitious about not remaining celibate.

34.title: Pokémon Réburst, Chapter 1
34.plot: Linkara reviews a Pokémon Manga. Although he had sworn never to review a Manga, he is not someone to bite the hand that feeds him. Reburst, Chapter 1 is a cryptic, obscure Pokémon book with oddly-translated "Engrish" and is darker and more violent than the usual pocket monster adventures.

35.title: Green Lantern #23.1
35.plot: Returning to the New 52 upon request, Linkara looks at their line of "Villains Month" comics, highlighting all those intriguing D.C. super-villains the readers are always fascinated with. Today's comic is about Relic, a somewhat new Green Lantern villain.

36.title: Team Youngblood #1
36.plot: Hope everybody got their Youngblood's Disease shots because Linkara is going to review another Youngblood comic. This isn't part of the main series, it's actually a sub-series. Issue #1 features a powerful, diabolical madman named Giger, who takes over a space station orbiting Earth, and only a ragtag group of weird superheroes can save the day.

37.title: US-1 #5
37.plot: Picking up where the last issue left off, U.S. had just finished a race with Baron Von Blimp with a blimp versus a truck. Now he's in another race, this time against another truck, being driven by Ulysses' old flame Taryn. The race takes him to a maze full of natural disasters, up to and including beings from another world.

38.title: The Star Wars #2
38.plot: A long time ago from a comic publisher not far enough away came The Star Wars #2, and the Force is not strong with this one. Picking up where the last one left off, General Luke Starkiller sends his son Annikin to pick up Princess Leia, and when he does, he punches her because he's a dick. Also, R2 and C-3PO show up and the little droid actually talks. Outside of all that and an awkward space battle, it's nothing to shake a gaffi stick at.

39.title: Power Man and Iron Fist #79
39.plot: Linkara reviews a comic featuring Power Man and Iron Fist, and it's basically the genres of blaxploitation and kung-fu getting into a head-on collision. Who requested this, the Cinema Snob? The story features our heroes investigating some mysterious occurrences going on backstage of a Broadway theater, featuring robots, time travel and an unexpected connection to the franchise of a famous time lord. Can you guess Who?

40.title: Nightmares on Elm Street #1-2
40.plot: One, Two, Linkara's coming for you. That's right, he's reviewing issues #1 and 2 of Nightmares on Elm Street to welcome the Halloween season. This series serves as a prequel to the film Freddy's Dead, and hints at a possible connection between Freddy Krueger and Jack the Ripper.

41.title: Nightmares on Elm Street #3-4
41.plot: Three, Four, lock'em behind a door. Linkara continues his nightmarish quest through Nightmares on Elm Street with issues 3 and 4. It's three years later, and everything from issues 1 and 2 has been rendered totally irrelevant. Don't ya hate it when that happens? This time around, Freddy is stalking Alice once again, and it turns out her son Jacob is clairvoyant, which they hope they can use against the Christmas-sweater wearing psycho. Meanwhile, Linkara seems to be trapped in a nightmare himself...while he's still awake.

42.title: Nightmares on Elm Street #5-6
42.plot: Five, Six, what a bizarre mix. Linkara concludes his 3-part look at Freddy's venture into comics with Nightmares on Elm Street issues 5 and 6. Alice goes into the dreamworld to confront Freddy in order to save her son, while Divonne tries to kill Dr. Gordon. Thankfully, Nancy comes to save the day. While Freddy may have been defeated in the comics, he jumps out to terrorize Linkara in a living nightmare. The two engage in a battle of wits and magic. Who will successfully outdo the other?

43.title: Spider-Man: Virtual Mortality
43.plot: Linkara wakes up after a long sleep, and a battle of wits with Freddy Krueger, in time to celebrate his 7th anniversary. And of course, the Spider-Man Clone Saga is further explored to mark the occasion. The real Spider-Man finally stands up and starts anew the Skarlett Spider.

44.title: More Fun Comics #73
44.plot: Secret Origins Month 2015 begins with the story of Green Arrow. In this harrowing implausible first adventure, the green-clad archer and his sidekick Speedy (Roy Harper) set out to stop a killer who murders those who share surnames with famous historical figures.

45.title: Daredevil #1
45.plot: Linkara explores the secret origin of Daredevil: the man without fear. Though blind, his other senses are heightened, making him a force to be reckoned with. By day, he's Matt Murdock, a well-ready attorney. How he got to this point is a very strange, yet intriguing tale as only Stan the Man could deliver.

46.title: Action Comics #252
46.plot: Where did Supergirl come from? There are so many issues about her origins, her relationship to Superman, so many stories going in so many directions it's caused huge rifts in the DC universe. But Linkara believes he's found the true origin story of The Supergirl from Krypton. She's Superman's cousin, having survived Krypton's destruction through convoluted means and was sent to Earth by her parents, only to be discovered by Superman who dumps her at the orphanage.

47.title: Tales of Suspense #52
47.plot: Secret Origins Month 2015 closes out with the origin story of a villain: Black Widow. Back in the Golden Age, Natasha Romanoff, a.k.a. Claire Voyant, was an agent of evil sent to destroy Iron Man who threatens their plans for a top secret laser.

48.title: Atop the Fourth Wall: The Movie, Part 1
48.plot: Linkara and his friends embark on a mission to Jupiter to save a manned spacecraft that has lost communication with Earth.

49.title: Atop the Fourth Wall: The Movie, Part 2
49.plot: Comicron One finds the Caelestis in a debris field. But what looks like a slightly abnormal accident quickly escalates into a full-on battle as Linkara is reunited with an old enemy, who has nefarious plans for the crew.

50.title: Atop the Fourth Wall: The Movie, Part 3
50.plot: With the ship damaged and supplies depleting, Linkara and the crew decide to head for the Eexecutor's abandoned base on Europa. Mechakara heads that way too, determined to eliminate Linkara once and for all, while on board Comicron One, the hat-wearing comic reviewer is experiencing an existential crisis from which his friends need to snap him out if they are all to survive.

51.title: Atop the Fourth Wall: The Movie, Part 4
51.plot: After a brief battle with Mechakara in the Europa base, Linkara finally begins to get a grasp on his true lot in life.

52.title: Atop the Fourth Wall: The Movie, Part 5
52.plot: In the explosive finale, Comicron One engages in a firefight with Caelestis, but manage to rescue the assimilated crew before the ship explodes. Then they all join Linkara down on Europa to engage in a showdown with Mechakara. An epic fight to the finish. To prove once and for all, who is a MAN.

53.title: Deadpool Bi-Annual #1
53.plot: We're in for a treat today, because not only is Linkara reviewing his first proper Deadpool comic, but Brute Force is back. Worlds are gonna collide, and it's gonna be seriously funny.

54.title: Cho Dengeki Stryker
54.plot: December is here, but before Linkara can properly deck the halls with howls of folly, the Powers That Be (his Patreon sponsors) implore him to review a Japanese visual novel. It's all kinds of wrong.

55.title: Zombies Christmas Carol #1-3
55.plot: So many re-tellings of Charles Dickens' classic tale of A Christmas Carol, each with their own unique spin. Take Marvel for instance, who felt what this timeless story was missing was the undead. Join Linkara as he reads issues 1-3 of Zombies Christmas Carol - or The Walking Humbug.

56.title: Zombies Christmas Carol #4-5
56.plot: Linkara resumes the zombie version of A Christmas Carol in which Scrooge is visited by the Ghost of Christmas Yet to Come - or will never come. The specter shows Scrooge a future in which zombies have taken over the world, as well as his whole house. The miser must learn to embrace Christmas and show good will to his fellow man in order to save the human race. Yep, just as Charles Dickens intended.

57.title: Another 15 Missed Opportunities of AT4W
57.plot: Linkara comes down with another case of "I should've said that" and looks back on 15 occasions when he reviewed a comic and wish he had inserted a joke, a meme or poignant observation. To close out 2015, Linkara looks back at the Top 15 Missed Opportunities of Atop the Fourth Wall. Why Top 15? He likes to go 5 steps beyond.

1.title: NFL SuperPro Special Edition #1
1.plot: Linkara kicks off the new year with some football. But since he's early for the Super Bowl, he decides to look at some SuperPro. It's been a while since he's visited this series, and there are plenty of good reasons why. This issue features our helmeted, padded jock hero going after an evildoer who sells steroids to athletes.

2.title: Popeye: Borned to the Sea #1
2.plot: Well, blow me down. Linkara finally gets to talk about everybody's favorite spinach-eating super sailor, courtesy of his Patreon mateys. This story chronicles Popeye's life from birth on board a ship at sea, his Pappy shipping out on him, and the young man growing up on an all-spinach diet and developing a keen knack for fighting. This provides techniques for both survival and wacky hijinks.

3.title: Onstar Batman Auto Show Special Edition
3.plot: The first PSA Hell of 2016 is a short comic for OnStar, starring the Caped Crusader. The Commissioner has been kidnapped by the Riddler, and in order to locate him and bring that crazy conundrum king to justice, Batman will need a little help from a commercial car security service. Hopefully he didn't buy it with a Bat Credit Card.

4.title: Godzilla: Kingdom of Monsters #3
4.plot: Linkara returns to the Kingdom of Monsters, even though it's still yet to be established. So while the monsters are still wreaking havoc on three continents, the comic decides to focus on a pair of freaky twin girls, more asshole children, and cultural satire for the brain-dead.

5.title: The Star Wars #3
5.plot: A few minutes ago in an apartment a good distance away...Linkara has returned to the comic franchise of The Star Wars, with the third issue. Little does Linkara know that this is the issue where things finally start to take shape, resembling the movie whose source material originated from this story. Roles may be reversed and 1 character may become 3, but it is indeed one with the Force of Others.

6.title: Youngblood #8
6.plot: More wacky, inconsistent and overcrowded fun with Rob Liefeld's shameful excuse for a comic series. Today, Linkara looks at issue #8,000 where our poorly-drawn heroes fighting equally poorly-drawn foes in positions no human acrobat could imitate, and we get some poorly timed backstory. Oh, and Spawn is here too for some reason.

7.title: All-Star Batman and Robin #10
7.plot: After 10 agonizing issues, All-Star Crazy Steve and Dick Grayson Age 12 finally comes to a close. So how does this harrowing saga of murder, kidnapping, child endangerment, misogyny, sex, scandals, perversion, and time jumps that would make all 13 Doctors crap themselves end? Batman and Robin are pushed aside to make way for a vulgar Batgirl story.

8.title: Pokémon Adventures Ch. 1-2
8.plot: To celebrate the 20th anniversary of his all-time favorite Anime franchise, which is Pokémon for the few people who don't know, Linkara takes a look at--what else? A Pokémon comic. After an exhaustive search for a decent enough book, he settles on Pokémon Adventures.

9.title: Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger Episodes 1-5
9.plot: Go Go Patreon Sponsors. Linkara's generous masters have requested he review the first five episodes of a Super Sentai known as Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger. More Japanese Power Rangers. But he's happy to do it, because Linkara is secretly a Power Rangers fan. Not many people know this, but he does enjoy that franchise.

10.title: Blue-Skying, Part 1: Blue Beetle Dan Garrett
10.plot: Linkara begins his month-long retrospective of the unsung Blue Beetle. Linkara begins by lecturing on BB's secret origins, in which he was a rip-off of The Green Hornet. Since then, his costume and character both evolved, he got himself an obligatory kid sidekick, a Beetlemobile, and an arsenal of nonsensical super powers. Among the highlights detailed in this saga is Garrett going off to fight the Nazis, and learning a devilish secret about Hitler.

11.title: Blue-Skying, Part 2: Blue Beetle Ted Kord
11.plot: Linkara continues his Blue Beetle retrospective by looking at the Silver Age recreation of the character, and the second man to take on the mantle.

12.title: Blue-Skying, Part 3: Blue Beetle Jaime Reyes
12.plot: Linkara tells us about the third Blue Beetle: Jaime Reyes. This era of BB features time travel, space travel, a myriad of oddball characters and crossovers.

13.title: Blue-Skying, Part 4: Blue Beetle Jaime Reyes New 52
13.plot: As the month of March draws to a close, so does Linkara's retrospective on the history of the Blue Beetle. And what better way to end than to cover the character's tenure in DC Comic's reboot saga Linkara hates with every fiber of his being: The New 52.

14.title: Star Trek Special: Flesh and Stone
14.plot: Star Trek has lived long and prospered for 50 years, and being such a big Trekkie, Linkara honors the Enterprise's golden anniversary with a review of a comic that dared to bring the doctors of all five Star Trek series together for their own scientifically illogical space adventure. Can you say comic malpractice?

15.title: Blackest Night #1-8
15.plot: Linkara is forced once again to look at a good comic. Why? Because he isn't one to bite the hand that feeds his bank account. The comic de jour is Blackest Night. He looks at not one, but 8 issues surrounding life, death, resurrection, and everything in between.

16.title: Dart #1
16.plot: Show him the money, he'll show you the comic (provided you've followed the proper channels, that is). It's another Patreon sponsored review for Linkara today as he digs into Dart #1, a mean-spirited comic about a sexy superhero and a greedy toy company. Plenty of grammar errors and Liefeld-worthy artwork make this a blunder to behold.

17.title: Batman: Shadow of the Bat #58
17.plot: Linkara reads the third part of "Leaves of Grass" in which Batman battles the Floronic Man while fending off Poison Ivy's toxic advances, while Tim Drake gives us a lecture on the history of marijuana and its many good uses. And to think, the pages of this comic could've been better used as hemp.

18.title: Legend of Heroes: Trails in the Skies
18.plot: By popular demand (from 1 person), Linkara reviews a JRPG. It involves a fiendish plot to usurp the throne from Her Majesty, and the only ones fit to stop the forces of evil are two siblings turned lovers and the most likable character is the would-be villain. Yep, it's one of THOSE games.

19.title: Ultimate Power #3
19.plot: Linkara looks at issue 3 in the Ultimate Power universe, by Greg Land, who is literally retracing his steps. In this issue, the Fantastic Four, the Avengers, and a couple facsimiles set out to stop a bio-mass from engulfing the eastern seaboard.

20.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation #3
20.plot: Linkara continues his celebration of Star Trek's golden anniversary with issue #3 of The Next Generation comic series. It's an intergalactic battle of morals, plot holes and creative differences. Not to mention it prominently features one of the many banes of Linkara's existence: Q.

21.title: Comic Book Quickies #6
21.plot: Break out the fruit pies, it's time for another Comic Book Quickies. So, what little slices of pie does Linkara have to stomach this time? Spider-Man has to stop Printout-Man from not only causing a run on the bank, but from hoarding the city's supply of Hostess Cupcakes, a Beast Wars mini-comic with Megatron and Optimus Primal going toe to toe, a commercial comic on the dangers of "Spiromania", and Captain America teams up with Colgate Junior to stop Count Plaqula.

22.title: Marvel Super Special #7: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band
22.plot: For the 100th, it was a cartoon hedgehog in an unreal world. For the 200th, it was Spidey selling his soul in a story that is the bane of Linkara's existence. For the 300th, it was the worst piece of literature Frank Miller ever contributed to. Now, for #400, Linkara will review - a musical comic, as in a comic based off a terrible musical. It's a tuneful review with musical numbers and a ballad of guest stars.

23.title: Superman vs. The Amazing Spider-Man
23.plot: With Batman vs. Superman and Captain America vs. Iron Man playing out all over theater screens, Linkara decides to look back at the time Superman was pitted against Spider-Man. Marvel and DC's first crossover event. And as Linkara discovers, this little crossover battle is different from those that would come after it, because it's done exceptionally well. It doesn't just pull punches, because every punch has a purpose.

24.title: Titans/Young Justice: Graduation Day #1
24.plot: Linkara schools a disastrous Titans/Young Justice trilogy that was supposed to be the grand finale of both series (at the time). But these young crime-fighters go out with anything but a bang, because when you don't show the proper respect for continuity and previously developed characters, then you have the recipe for one sucktacular comic, and this is only Part 1. Linkara must brace himself for the incomprehensible spores of madness that await him in the next two issues.

25.title: Titans/Young Justice: Graduation Day #2
25.plot: Stupid is as stupid does with issue 2 of this Titans/Young Justice Graduation comic. Linkara covers more insanity as the two teams butt heads and point fingers instead of using their brains and fists.

26.title: Titans/Young Justice: Graduation Day #3
26.plot: Linkara finally closes out this trilogy of terror that is Titans/Young Justice: Graduation Day. It's pompous and circumstantial pandemonium as the gang engage in battle with an evil Superman robot which results in pointless deaths of significant characters. Graduation? Nope, this series needs to go to summer school.

27.title: 15 Things Wrong with Marvel's Civil War
27.plot: Linkara rants and raves about the politically incorrect event comic known as Civil War, going through 15 things that confuse, bewilder or just plain infuriate him.

28.title: Star Trek: Deep Space 9 #1
28.plot: Linkara reviews a comic from his favorite Star Trek series, Deep Space Nine. In this adventure, the team tries to control an outbreak of some experimental scientific mold that tries to take over the ship, all while trying to keep up with the Cardassians.

29.title: Minister of Chance Audio Dramas
29.plot: Always willing to try new things, especially when his Patreon sponsors demand it, Linkara decides to look at something he's never reviewed in all the 400+ episodes of his show: an audio drama. That's right, taking a break from printed media, Linkara reviews one of audio: a story in the Doctor Who-verse featuring a conflict between two nations, and a world where science is outlawed and magic is revered.

30.title: US-1 #6
30.plot: Ten-four, good buddy, Linkara's hauling a load with issue 6 of our favorite comic book truck driver, US-1. Each book has gotten weirder and weirder, and this one is no exception as our heroic trucker swoops in to help the owners of a local truck stop, who are behind on their mortgage payments. Being the all-American good guy he is, Ulysses won't let a greedy banker or a violent biker gang stand in his way of righting wrongs.

31.title: Star Trek: Voyager #1
31.plot: Stardate 8106: Linkara reviews the very first comic book adaptation of Star Trek: Voyager. Though not as exciting as the series, the comic does share one very important aspect with it: they take full advantage of the "fiction" in 'science fiction.'

32.title: Unsounded, Chapter 1
32.plot: "A Reluctant Escort" is an apropos title for the first chapter of Unsounded, as Linkara is reluctant to escort his viewers through this web comic. However, this journey is mandated by the Kingdom of Patreon, to whom Linkara has pledged his loyalty. Unsounded tells the tale of an obnoxious young princess and her reluctant zombie escort have to avoid many treacherous and deadly obstacles - mainly each other.

33.title: Biggles and the Menace from Space
33.plot: Patreon's wish is Linkara's command. This week's outing is an odd sci-fi comic about a classic, seldom-known comic character called James Bigglesworth, or Biggles for short. In this adventure, the brazen pilot has to solve the mystery of a space station that seemingly launched itself and is threatening to nuke the entire world.

34.title: Batman and Robin: The Official Comic Adaptation
34.plot: The world's greatest detective in the world's worst movie made for an unsavory combination, but, of course, there had to be a comic adaptation. So, Linkara digs into the comic version of Batman and Robin, to compare and contrast with the ludicrous film. And, of course, you-know-who shows up to do the mandatory Bat Credit Card freak-out...but Linkara's one step ahead to nip that old meme in the bud.

35.title: Superman and the TRS-80 Computer Whiz Kids: Victory by Computer
35.plot: Because Superman had nothing better to do, he's back to hock more Tandy computer products with the Whiz Kids. Linkara delves into the latest adventures of the Whiz Shills that features not only Superman, but Supergirl as well, helping to push the latest state-of-the-art, groundbreaking technology 1981 had to offer.

36.title: Star Trek/Green Lantern: The Spectrum War
36.plot: With the fate of the world resting in his hands, vowing not to rest until he can decipher a mysterious message from the future, Linkara takes a rest anyway to review a Star Trek/Green Lantern crossover comic. It's the Trek's 50th anniversary, and Linkara marks the occasion with a comic in which universes collide, the Lantern rings come in the possession of the Enterprise crew, and all sorts of wacky hijinks ensue.

37.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic #27-28
37.plot: Sponsorship is Magic as My Little Patreon encourages Linkara to bite the bullet and review a My Little Pony comic. He gets more than he bargained for with a magical adventure about the ponies using magic and friendship to save the green forests from an unscrupulous land developer.

38.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! GX Ch. 1
38.plot: It's mega manga time again as Linkara commemorates the 20th anniversary of Yu-Gi-Oh. While he's not very hip on the original series, he is a BIG fan of GX. While the manga is not without flaws, Linkara finds it to be a somewhat solid story about two teams using their magic cards to create monsters. Each team making sure their deck is larger...that's deck of cards, you pervs.

39.title: Pryde of the X-Men
39.plot: The light of Patreon shines brightly upon Linkara tonight, as they've selected a topic that's very near and dear to him to review: comic books. Though not really a book, it's the pilot to an X-Men animated series that was never made. Being a big fan of the superhero mutants and all their wacky friends and enemies, Linkara looks over this 1989 effort and tries to see why this show never made it to series.

40.title: A Nightmare on Elm Street: Paranoid #1
40.plot: Linkara has good reasons to feel paranoid. His spaceship is destroyed, there's an evil presence stalking him, and most of all, it's October. Halloween is right around the corner, which means more of that jovial murderous ghoul Freddy Kruger. In this gory mini-series, Freddy attempts to get all the teens of Springwood to fear him again, and with this gang of misfits and pushovers, he's got his work cut out for him. Dull story if you can read between the lines.

41.title: A Nightmare on Elm Street: Paranoid #2
41.plot: The nightmare continues...for Linkara, who still has two more issues of this crap. In Paranoid #2: Insomniac Boogaloo, we pick up where we left off, with Freddy causing more of his trademark mayhem for a group of clueless teenagers. And Linkara has a few of his own supernatural forces with malevolent intent to deal with.

42.title: A Nightmare on Elm Street: Paranoid #3
42.plot: Linkara is ready for this Nightmare to end as he gets to issue 3, and while it did show some potential for interesting ideas, it simply pissed them all away for shoddy exposition and cheap thrills. Once he gets through this nightmare, Linkara must face the other one stalking him in the real world.

43.title: Spider-Man: Cyberwar
43.plot: Spider-Man, Spider-Man. Can this comic suck? You bet it can. In honor of Linkara's 8th anniversary, he keeps in tradition of reviewing another entry in the ludicrous Clone Saga series. Ben Reilly finds difficulty in balancing the life of a superhero and a civilian, while some cyber criminals use the art of virtual reality to upload data about people and use them for dastardly purposes. Meanwhile, to understand the nefarious entities in his new house, Linkara seeks help from an old friend, who once experienced a dark side.

44.title: The Real Ghostbusters in Ghostbusters II #1-3
44.plot: If something sucks, on your comic shelf, who you gonna call? Linkara. This Halloween special includes a review of three Ghostbusters II comics featuring the Real Ghostbusters. Worlds collide as the cartoon meets the second movie, which Linkara deems better than the first. And speaking of ghosts, Linkara still has that pesky entity haunting his new house to worry about. Fortunately, though, he's got some help.

45.title: Strange Tales #110
45.plot: Secret Origins Month 2016 is off to a Strange start. The new Doctor Strange movie has hit theaters and so Linkara decides to look at the origins of the good doctor. The master of black magic.

46.title: More Fun Comics #73: Aquaman
46.plot: Linkara dives deep to bring us the origins of Aquaman, that hero of the sea. If you've ever wondered who he was, where he came from, and how he single-handedly defeated the Nazis, here is your answer.

47.title: Tales of Suspense #57
47.plot: It's another mysterious origin for Linkara as he looks at the coming of that unsung heroic archer Hawkeye. An overlooked showman at Coney Island, he witnesses Iron Man's heroics and decides he can do the same thing too. After he bungles his first attempt at heroism, he finds himself recruited by Black Widow to defeat Iron Man.

48.title: All-Star Comics #3
48.plot: Before the Avengers and the Justice League, and even the Super Friends, there was the Justice Society of America. To wrap up Secret Origins Month 2016, Linkara looks at their origin. Featuring such memorable members as The Atom, The Sandman, The Spectre, The Hawkman, The Hourman, Dr. Fate, and Johnny Thunder. Each one has a fascinating story to tell...all of which are told in this one comic.

49.title: My Little Pony 2015 Holiday Special
49.plot: Linkara begins the Christmas season with galloping hysterics, as he looks at a My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Christmas comic. It wasn't a Patreon request, but he's still reviewing it for the money. Hey, comic reviewers with magic guns who save the world on a monthly basis need to eat too. In this comic, Twilight and Spike are snowed in at the train station and worried they'll miss Pinkie Pie's party. To pass the time: stories within a story.

50.title: Ghostbusters: Past, Present, and Future
50.plot: If you've ever wondered what a Christmas Carol/Ghostbusters crossover would be like, The Real Ghostbusters made such an episode about it 30 years ago. However, much like A Christmas Carol itself, there can be many retellings of the story via different methods and characters. And so today, as Linkara continues his celebration of A Franchise Christmas, reads a comic adaptation of the Ghostbusters tangling with the Ghosts of Christmas Past, Present and Future, and watch as greed, avarice and mistrust nearly break up the team.

51.title: Elvira's House of Mystery Special #1
51.plot: Seasons creepings from Atop the Fourth Wall, as Linkara digs an Elvira comic from his Christmas stocking. The horror hostess made her way to print media with a bizarre comic that has a dozen names. And much like her TV shows, Elvira's comic is an anthology: a version of A Christmas Carol to scare the Dickens out of you, Santa Claus committing a hit and run, a possessed homicidal Christmas tree, and aliens visiting a post-apocalyptic Earth have a run-in with Jolly St. Nick.

52.title: Another 15 Screw-Ups of AT4W
52.plot: Linkara reflects back on the year 2016, listing the many highs and the over-abundance of lows. But most of all, he reflects on himself and his own fortunes, good and bad. Including mistakes he's made, and he's counted down 15 of the most glaring ones to date. Or at least the ones he didn't mention in past Top 15 Screw-Up videos.

1.title: Digimon: Digital Monsters #1
1.plot: The start of the new year sees Linkara getting his Mon on by looking at a Digimon comic. Five kids at a summer camp get more than they bargained for when they come across these adorable little digital devils, who come from an alternate reality that truly plays by its own rules.

2.title: Phonogram: The Immaterial Girl #1-6
2.plot: This next number is a surreal comic on music videos requested by Linkara's questionably loyal Patreon sponsors. Despite thinking musical comics are bogus, Linkara still looks at six issues of insanity about a morose girl who makes a deal with a mysterious entity behind a TV screen to sacrifice a piece of herself for something better...and it doesn't go as planned. Battles from within one's self never do.

3.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles #1
3.plot: Linkara's Patreon dudes requested a bodacious comic today, it's the debut of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. But these are your older brother's Ninja Turtles from the dark, gritty Mirage comics. This semi-Secret Origins Month episode tells the origins of the Turtles, Splinter and The Shredder. So if you wanna see how it all really began, this is your slice of pizza.

4.title: Trouble #3
4.plot: Linkara is in trouble again, as he is now at Issue 3. Teen angst, animosity, love triangles, and of course, sex are all the rage the third part of this sorry saga. And, because someone didn't use protection, May becomes pregnant. With this backstory of his parents and aunt and uncle's early courtship days, it's no wonder Peter became so messed up.

5.title: The Star Wars #4
5.plot: The Force of Others is mildly strong with this one. As Linkara reviews issue #4 of what Star Wars probably would've been had George Lucas completely gotten his way, our heroes seek transport off Acquilea with the droids. They meet a jolly green swashbuckler who may be of some help.

6.title: Spectacular Spider-Man: "Persona"
6.plot: Linkara grants another Patreon sponsor's wish by looking at a TV show, instead of a comic. It was one of Spidey-s many forays onto the small screen, and since Linkara is a big Spider-Man fanatic, except for that one comic that shall remain nameless, he looks at an episode of the short-lived Spectacular Spider-Man series.

7.title: Youngblood #9
7.plot: Linkara goes back to his roots, in the very early days of internet reviewing, he wrote blogs on comic books. The first book he blogged about was the first issue of Youngblood. And now, ten years later, with his own successful video reviewing series, he's at Youngblood #9. Fortunately Liefeld had little to do with this one, but that doesn't stop it from being an all-out mess. It's a satirical look at Hollywood and stardom as Badrock heads to L.A. to star in his own TV show.

8.title: The A-Team #2
8.plot: Linkara laments not reviewing any Mr. T related comics the previous year, and for that, we pity the fool. However, he decides to get back on track and review The A-Team #2. In this harrowing adventure, our heroes set out to rescue the elderly father of some video game magnates from a dangerous Japanese ninja cult.

9.title: The Batman/Superman Movie: World's Finest
9.plot: It's no surprise that so many DC fans were disappointed with the live action Batman vs. Superman movie.So, Linkara sees the Patreon signal in the sky and receives a request to review the animated, and much better version that came out 20 years earlier.

10.title: See You Next Mirror: Exiles Retrospective, Part 1
10.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

11.title: See You Next Mirror: Exiles Retrospective, Part 2
11.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

12.title: Reagan's Raiders #1
12.plot: Even though Linkara previously established a desire not to review political comics, he decides to make an exception with one notoriously bad book that depicts former president Ronald Reagan as a Rambo-style bad-ass who has to save the country from a nuclear meltdown caused by dastardly super villains.

13.title: Fist of the North Star, Ch. 1
13.plot: Never let it be said Linkara doesn't work hard for the money, as this week's Patreon request is Fist of the North Star, or at least the first chapter of the infamous manga. It's a post-apocalyptic world where mankind is at each other's throats to preserve what little resources they have left, when from out of the hot, dusty desert air came a lone wanderer. A hero. His name was Max - er, Kenshiro. Don't get mad.

14.title: Godzilla: Kingdom of Monsters #4
14.plot: Who are the real monsters? The overgrown reptiles causing chaos and destruction throughout the cities of earth, or the overblown comic writers causing chaos and destruction through horrible written trite with brain-dead pop culture satire and one-dimensional characters? That is the question Linkara poses as he tortures himself with issue #4 of Godzilla: Kingdom of Crap.

15.title: Iron Man: The Animated Series: The Wedding of Iron Man
15.plot: Linkara is requested to review an episode of the lesser-known Iron Man animated series in which Tony gets hitched. As he stands at the altar, he remembers back to the action-packed events that lead up to this union ala the series' first semi-clip show. Bad jokes and little attention to the titular wedding, plus it has a twist ending worthy of Shyamalan.

16.title: Athena #3
16.plot: Ancient Greek Wackyness is present and accounted for in Athena #3, the second sequel to the comic known for it's overuse of T&A, with extra A. Like the last issue, Linkara put off reviewing this one for as long as he could, and finds that he hasn't missed much, because not much as happened. It's a perfect display of what happens when the Greek Gods exchange their powers to take on the forms of mortals, and among those powers is brain power.

17.title: Batman: The Dark Knight #1-3
17.plot: By popular request via Patreon, Linkara reviews one of the New 52 Batman comics. If you thought All-Star Batman and Robin was bad - it still is, but here are three issues of another book that is bat-shit insane (pun intended). In this tale of wackiness, the Dark Knight monologues about fear while having to face off against Two-Face, who is now a giant mutated monster and calling himself One-Face, despite still having two, and a mysterious Playboy bunny seems to be behind it all. Just a sample of the crazy mess Linkara has now gotten himself into.

18.title: The New Teen Titans Anti-Drug Giveaway #2
18.plot: PSA Hell returns with a comic voted on by Linkara's Patreon sponsors. The New Teen Titans set out to rid the city of drugs and their dealers, while helping Not-Robin's cousin, a former addict, not give in to the temptations around him.

23.title: Babylon 5 #1
23.plot: Linkara is a big fan of the show Babylon 5, so he decides to review a tie-in comic. An ex-position-filled yarn about Commander Sinclair receiving a giant blast from the past involving Earth's government and his own mind.

24.title: The Star Wars #5
24.plot: It is an uncertain time for Linkara. Although Comicron One has been destroyed, he has managed to keep unseen threats at bay and maintain business as usual. Among such distractions is The Star Wars #5, where Luke, Han, Annikin, Leia, Whitesun and the droids escape Imperial ambush and head to Ophuchi. All the while, there's a strong love-hate relationship forming between Annikin and Leia, in true Star Wars tradition.

25.title: All-New Ghost Rider, Volume 2
25.plot:
Know what this is about?

26.title: Robocop vs. The Terminator #2
26.plot: Linkara gears up for more Miller Time, returning to the franchise of Robocop vs. The Terminator. This time around, the woman from the future who claims Robocop is responsible for bringing SkyNet online and bringing about the eradication of the human race is proven to be telling the truth. Now Robo must protect her and fight off an onslaught of Terminators to prevent this possible future.

27.title: Superman vs. The Terminator #2
27.plot: Time is out of joint as Linkara reads issue 2 of the Superman vs. The Terminator saga. While Superman is stuck in the future helping the resistance take down SkyNet, the machines plot to send an army of terminators back to the past to kill John Connor, Superman and all of humanity.

28.title: Tandy Computer Whiz Kids: News by Computer Foils Kidnappers
28.plot: What can be expected from the next entry in the Whiz Kids saga? Perpetually returning from summer vacation? Plugs for primitive, early '80s computer products? A sinister plot to abduct children at a state fair? What comes to no surprise to Linkara is that like always, comics designed to sell computers think they're best suited to include hard-hitting, real-life dramatic situations. Because trying to hit close to home is always the best way to plug a 1981 brick cordless phone.

29.title: Ultimate Power #4
29.plot: Linkara successfully completes work on Comicron Two and takes her on her maiden voyage. To celebrate the christening of his new space ship, he reviews a terrible comic. Issue four of Ultimate Power, featuring our zany heroes crossing dimensions to fight foes, but forgetting to take a tangible story with them. And Greg Land boldly goes where no tracer has gone before.

30.title: Delicious in Dungeon, Vol. 1
30.plot: While Linkara battles a nefarious inner conflict, he manages to take time out to fulfill a Patreon sponsor request. It's a fantasy Manga about a ragtag gang setting out to save a girl from a monster, only they come face to face with a much more power foe: hunger.

31.title: Batman: Odyssey #1
31.plot: One of the better Batman writers who was responsible for bringing the Dark Knight back to his dark roots in the '70s has since come of retirement and written another comic series about him. Linkara reviews issue #1 of the new series, relieved that it wasn't Frank Miller who penned it - although the concept and subject matter isn't too far from typical Miller territory.

32.title: Asterix: The Legionary
32.plot: The Sponsors of Patreon have requested that Linkara cover a comic from the famous Asterix series. Being unfamiliar with the material, he agrees to review The Legionary, which follows our bumbling, roughhousing heroes on a quest to save the missing fiancee of a girl with whom Obelix has become smitten.

33.title: Comic Book Quickies #7
33.plot: Ready for a quickie? Linkara has even more comic shorts and one-page ads to satisfy our cravings. So, what did comic publishers trick unsuspecting kids into buying this time? Well, we've got more footwear follies as a kid trips a carjacker with his pair of Dingo boots; hip dino Rocky D. pushing rock candy; a kid conquering the game world with a wireless controller; and finally, Superman catching crooks in disguise as an even more powerful superhero: a Hostess salesman.

34.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventures Episodes 1-4
34.plot: Linkara is not too familiar with the Jojo Manga and subsequent anime OVA, but the Patreon sponsors requested it and so he must give them a look anyway. He reviews the first four episodes of JoJo's Bizarre Adventures that truly live up to the show's name. There are ninjas, vampires, and even Jack the Ripper.

35.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
35.plot: With the Entity threatening the lives of Linkara and his friends, and time being of the essence to stop it once and for all, Linkara decides to pause and recenter himself by reviewing a comic--er, movie. Hey, the sponsors requested it and he's got a brand new spaceship to pay for. Remember the Thunderbirds? They were basically your parents' Team America, only not as vulgar or funny.

36.title: Batman: The Official Movie Adaptation
36.plot: Linkara and the Nostalgia Critic team up to review the comic adaptation of the 1989 Tim Burton Batman movie. Witty banter bounces off the walls like bullets off the Bat's cape.

37.title: Ultimate Iron Man Vol. 1 #1-2
37.plot: Linkara's Patreon sponsors have requested him to review - a comic. A bad comic? Yup. What spore of madness is this? Well, haven't you always wanted to read an Iron Man comic without Iron Man and instead a scientific mishap about playing God with regenerating bacteria? If yes, then this is all your fault.

38.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic #11-12
38.plot: The Magic of Patreon forces Linkara back to Equestria with another My Little Pony comic. They call it pony love as a high school nerd vies for the affections of an in-name-only princess. When he's finally done with that, Linkara rejoins his friends in outer space to combat and hopefully defeat the Entity once and for all.

39.title: Stormwatch #0
39.plot: The fate of the world hangs in the balance as Lord Vyce seizes control of Comicron One, locking the crew in the brig. Despite Linkara insisting that the Entity is no more, Vyce is hellbent on finishing what he started. Fortunately for Linkara, it isn't so urgent that he can't take time out to review a Patreon-requested comic.

40.title: A Nightmare on Elm Street: The Beginning #1-2
40.plot: In this comic continuation of Freddy's Dead, it seems Freddy may not be dead after all. As is tradition to start off the month of Halloween, Linkara reviews another Nightmare on Elm Street comic that picks up where the sixth film left off. Maggie is having nightmares about possibly becoming Freddy, and so she travels back to Springwood to learn more about who her father really was.

41.title: A Nightmare on Elm Street: Fearbook
41.plot: A paranoid Linkara looks at the Nightmare on Elm Street comic that follows the Paranoia mini-series. As far as story, character, coherency and artwork, it's dry as a bone. As Springwood has all but managed to cure themselves of Freddy by the miracle of modern medicine, four out-of-town armed robbers knock off a liquor store and one way or another, each one has a run-in with a very restless Freddy and his laundry list of puns.

42.title: New Line Cinema's Tales of Horror #1
42.plot: Linkara continues his month-long tribute to the man of our dreams with New Line Cinema's Tales of Horror #1, which features not only Freddy, but Leatherface too. Unfortunately, they don't duke it out, they just get their own stories: a chainsaw salesman narrowly misses having Leatherface for a customer, and Freddy manages to recruit some mortal sociopaths to do his dirty work.

44.title: Freddy vs. Jason vs. Ash
44.plot: Linkara finishes off Halloween by reading the ultimate horror crossover comic: Freddy vs. Jason vs. Ash, three slashers from three franchises going toe to toe to toe. A once proposed sequel to Freddy vs. Jason, now a 6-issue mini-series, there's bound to be knives and puns being hurled in rapid succession.

48.title: Clive Barker's Hellraiser Dark Holiday Special
48.plot: Nothing says Christmas like sadomasochism, which is why Linkara has decided to start the Christmas season off on a jolly note with that most festive of horror franchises: Hellraiser. Pandora's Box is wrapped in pretty paper and bows, just waiting to be unwrapped.

49.title: Sensation Comics #14: The Story of Fir Balsam
49.plot: Linkara delivers another bundle of Christmas fun with a comic about a magic Christmas tree, Nazis, and Wonder Woman.

50.title: Steam Wars Holiday Special
50.plot: Everyone and their goldfish knows about The Star Wars Holiday Special and what a horrible stain it is on the franchise, but few people know about a similar holiday special that's goofy for all the RIGHT reasons. Prepare to get stirred, whipped and steamed as Linkara reviews The STEAM WARS Holiday Special.

imdb.plot outline: Linkara is a witty, sarcastic young adult who reviews comic books of very poor detail, ranging from bad artwork to bad writing. Occasionally, characters from the comics as well as the comics themselves come to life and terrorize Linkara. Not only that, but other-worldly creatures often invade his house and try to take him hostage. He survives it all using his vast knowledge of comics and their many faults.
imdb.title: Atop the Fourth Wall
